info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:42AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Hamilton and northwestern Warren Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 742 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Speculator, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Warrensburg, Speculator, Johnsburg, Eagle Point Campground, Scaroon Manor Public Campground, Chestertown, North Creek, Sodom, Starbuckville, Edwards Hill, Wevertown, Pottersville, Holcombville, North River, South Horicon, Adirondack, Riverbank, Darrowsville, Byrnes Corners and Riparius. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 24 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
